hero.title: The wines of Les Crêtes: Passion, Tradition and Innovation in the Mountains

intro.title: Our label: the heroic expression of the Alps in the bottle

descrizione.text: Immediate and essential, it expresses our connection with the mountain territory, made of steep slopes, the alpine ridges, which here reach the highest peaks (hence the French name Les Crêtes). The metal foil cast in relief, to enhance the depth of the valleys carved by glaciers. ilver and copper reflecting, representing the brightness of our sun.

The vineyards, outlined on the peaks in the various exhibitions, represent the richness of a terroir stolen from the mountains. And at their feet, the Wine Refuge with our cellar, an ode to heroic viticulture that allows us a niche production, cradled by the Alps.

content.name: Merlot Le Merle Valle D'Aosta DOP
Fumin La Cor Valle d’Aosta D.O.P.
Pinot Nero Revei Valle d’Aosta D.O.P.

merle.name: Merlot Le Merle Valle D'Aosta DOP
merle.title: merle
merle.vinificazione: Destemming of refrigerated grapes, whole cluster fermentation for 12 days at controlled temperature (25°C), with daily pump-overs. Aging for 18 months in 300L French oak barrels, with 50% new and 50% second use. Bottle aging for 12 months.
merle.zona: Aymavilles. Age: 25 years. Area: approximately 0.50 ha, Guyot training system; 7,500 vines per hectare. Yield: 6,500 kg/ha.
merle.affinamento: Aging for 18 months in 300L French oak barrels, with 50% new and 50% second use. Bottle aging for 12 months.

content.text: Fine and soft, le Merle was born from the desire of Elena and Eleonora to experiment and innovate. With this international variety, Les Crêtes challenges the vocation of the Valdostano terroir to produce a mountain merlot, of great consistency and elegance. It is called Le Merle, from the French Merle, because the vineyard during the harvest is crowded with blackbirds, which are greedy.

content.title: YEAR 2015
content.text: Our label expresses the essential link with the mountain territory, made of steep slopes and alpine ridges, which reach here the highest peaks (hence the French name Les Crêtes). The metal foil cast in relief, bright as our sun, to enhance the depth of the valleys carved by glaciers. The vineyards, drawn on the peaks in the different exhibitions, to represent the wealth of a land stolen from the mountains. And at their feet, the Wine Refuge with our cellar, an ode to heroic viticulture and terroir, which allow us a niche production, cradled by the Alps.

content.title: YEAR 2020
content.text: The year 2020 was characterized by a very hot and dry spring, followed by the months of May and June with temperatures below average; the summer course was regular, As well as the harvest season, which began in the first days of September. The harvest ended at the beginning of November with the cutting of late varieties, Petite Arvine and Fumin; in general the vines had an abundant and very balanced production, aspects that are reflected on wines, which are endowed with great elegance and verticality.
Donkey’s crook, Florentine, veal ossobuco, lamb rack.

cornalin.name: Cornalin Valle d’Aosta D.O.P.
cornalin.title: cornalin
cornalin.vinificazione: Pressing, 10 days of temperature controlled stainless steel fermentation (23°C)
cornalin.zona: Les Crêtes of Aymavilles. Area 1 hectare, system a Guyot, 7.000 feet per hectare, filari a ciglione e ritocchino. Yield 7000 kg/ha
cornalin.affinamento: 3 months in oak barriques of second passage from 300L, 3 months aging in bottle

content.text: Fragrant, particular and harmonious, the Cornalin is an autochthonous variety of ancient origins. Also called Corniola or Humagne Rouge, he arrived in the Valley from Burgundy Iar, consolidated its virtues and cultivation.

content.title: YEAR 2021
content.text: La nostra etichetta esprime il legame essenziale con il territorio di montagna, fatto di forti pendenze e di creste alpine, che qui raggiungono le vette più elevate (da cui il nome francese Les Crêtes). La lamina in metallo colato a rilievo, luminosa come il nostro sole, ad esaltare la profondità delle valli scavate dai ghiacciai. I vigneti, tratteggiati sulle vette nelle diverse esposizioni, a raffigurare la ricchezza di una terra rubata alle montagne. E ai loro piedi, il Rifugio del Vino con la nostra cantina, inno alla viticoltura eroica e al terroir, che ci permettono una produzione di nicchia, cullata dalle Alpi.

content.title: YEAR 2022
content.text: L’Year 2022 è stata caratterizzata da un lungo periodo di caldo e siccità anomalo, che dagli inizi di Maggio si è protratto fino ad Ottobre inoltrato; questo clima particolare ha portato un anticipo di vendemmia di circa 20 giorni, per cui l’inizio è stato il 16 Agosto, con le basi spumanti. La vendemmia si è conclusa negli ultimi giorni di Ottobre con i rossi a maturazione tardiva Fumin e Nebbiolo. I vini di quest’Year sono dotati di grande concentrazione ed aromaticità, nelle vigne più antiche e con radici profonde, c’è stata una tenuta di acidità abbondante, che ha portato ad una grande complessità nelle riserve.
Saltimbocca alla Valdostana with the alpine scents, robiola di capra, Duché d'Aoste, tagliatelle with egg and rabbit sauce.

rows: Vini Buoni d’Italia – Touring Club Italiano
Vini Buoni d’Italia – Touring Club Italiano

lacor.name: Fumin La Cor Valle d’Aosta D.O.P.
lacor.title: lacor
lacor.vinificazione: Destemming of the grapes, fermentation of 8/10 days in stainless steel at controlled temperature (22°c), with daily remixing.
lacor.zona: La Tour and Les Crêtes of Aymavilles. Age 34. Guyot system of breeding; plant of 7.500 feet per hectare, rows to ciglione and retouching.
lacor.affinamento: Aging of 12 months in French oak from 300 l. used. aging in bottle of 36 months.

content.text: This reserve is the result of the long refinement of our autochthonous Fumin. It is dedicated to the family’s historic mill in Via Moulins, which with its cellars has also been home to La Cor since 1700. The Cor in local architecture was the inner courtyard of a building, reserved for production and food exchange. This area played a major role in the local economy of the time, which did not include many monetary-type commercial exchanges, The European Commission has recently published a report on the situation in the United States. The Mill, in addition to the cellars, includes two large stone mills for the pressing of walnut oil, those for flour and tools for the production of cider and wine, to date in excellent condition.

content.title: YEAR 2015
content.text: Our label expresses the essential link with the mountain territory, made of steep slopes and alpine ridges, which reach here the highest peaks (hence the French name Les Crêtes). The metal foil cast in relief, bright as our sun, to enhance the depth of the valleys carved by glaciers. The vineyards, drawn on the peaks in the different exhibitions, to represent the wealth of a land stolen from the mountains. And at their feet, the Wine Refuge with our cellar, an ode to heroic viticulture and terroir, which allow us a niche production, cradled by the Alps.

content.title: YEAR 2020
content.text: The year 2020 was characterized by a very hot and dry spring, followed by the months of May and June with temperatures below average; the summer course was regular, As well as the harvest season, which began in the first days of September. The harvest ended at the beginning of November with the cutting of late varieties, Petite Arvine and Fumin; in general the vines had an abundant and very balanced production, aspects that are reflected on wines, which are endowed with great elegance and verticality.
Game, matured meats, Ivre de Fumin.

fumin.name: Fumin Valle d’Aosta D.O.P.
fumin.title: fumin
fumin.vinificazione: Destemming of the grapes, fermentation of 12 days in stainless steel at controlled temperature (24°C), with daily remixing.
fumin.zona: The Tour of Aymavilles. Age 30. Surface 2 ha, Guyot system; plant 7,500 feet per hectare, rows to ciglione and retouching. Yield 8,000 kg/ha.
fumin.affinamento: Aging of 12 months in French oak from 300 L. Aging in bottle of 6 months.

content.text: Intense and austere this autochthonous is the most structured red that gives us our land. Its name comes from the smoke-grey color of the berries, rich in pruine. Traditionally used in cuts for the intense color, it is threatened with extinction in the 70s when, saved by local Vignerons, it becomes part of the Aosta Valley DOC. In 1993, is vinified for the first time in purity by Les Crêtes, proving to be a wine of great elegance, suitable for long aging in bottle.

content.title: YEAR 1994
content.text: Our label expresses the essential link with the mountain territory, made of steep slopes and alpine ridges, which reach here the highest peaks (hence the French name Les Crêtes). The metal foil cast in relief, bright as our sun, to enhance the depth of the valleys carved by glaciers. The vineyards, drawn on the peaks in the different exhibitions, to represent the wealth of a land stolen from the mountains. And at their feet, the Wine Refuge with our cellar, an ode to heroic viticulture and terroir, which allow us a niche production, cradled by the Alps.

content.title: YEAR 2022
content.text: The 2022 vintage was characterized by a long period of heat and unusual drought, which lasted from the beginning of May until late October; this particular climate has brought a harvest advance of about 20 days, so the beginning was on August 16, with the bases sparkling. The harvest ended in the last days of October with the late-ripening reds Fumin and Nebbiolo. The wines of this vintage are endowed with great concentration and aromaticity, in the oldest vineyards and with deep roots, there has been a holding of abundant acidity, which has led to a great deal of complexity in the reserves.
Carbonada with polenta, venison mocetta, game braised.

monrouge.name: Mon Rouge®
monrouge.title: monrouge
monrouge.vitigni: Cornalin, Fumin, Vuillermin, Gamay, Petit Rouge
monrouge.tipologia: Blend of local black berry varieties: Cornalin, Fumin, Vuillermin, Gamay, Petit Rouge.
monrouge.vinificazione: Destemming of the refrigerated grapes, 7-day fermentation in stainless steel at controlled temperature (26°C), with daily replacements. con rimontaggi giornalieri
monrouge.zona: Various vineyards owned by the company located in the municipalities of Aymavilles, St. Pierre, Gressan and St. Christophe. Age years 15. Area 1.5 ha approximately, system at Guyot; plant of 7,500 feet per hectare, rows with ciglione and retouching. Yield 8,000 kg/ha.
monrouge.affinamento: Aging of 6 months in stainless steel.

content.text: This fresh and pleasant red is a blend of native varieties, dedicated to those who love. The simplicity and hook for a wine easy to drink.

content.title: YEAR 1995
content.text: Our label expresses the essential link with the mountain territory, made of steep slopes and Alpine ridges, which here reach the highest peaks (hence the French name Les Crêtes). The Metal cast in relief, bright as our sun, to exalt the depth of the valleys dug by glaciers. The vineyards, outlined on the peaks in the various exhibitions, to represent the wealth of a And at their feet, the Wine Hut with our cellar, a tribute to heroic viticulture and to the St. John’s The terroir, which allows us a niche production, cultured by the Alps.

content.title: YEAR 2023
content.text: The 2023 vintage was undoubtedly very important from all points of view, from May to June The temperature and precipitation were average after two years of heat and drought, and because of this the grape development was optimal. The month of August was characterized by waves of hot wind that have brought forward the harvest of the base sparkling to August 28, then proceed in good years spent for the collection of other varieties. The harvest ended at the end of October with the cutting of the Petite Arvine for whites and reds in early November, with the Fumin. The peculiarity of the vintage is that to have very savory and fresh wines, in general the varietal characteristics are accentuated and the reserves promise a great longevity.
Cold cuts and salami, pasta with meat sauce, soups, cheeses of medium maturation, red meats.

nebbiolo.name: Nebbiolo Valle d’Aosta D.O.P.
nebbiolo.title: nebbiolo
nebbiolo.vinificazione: Destemming of the grapes, fermentation in whole berries for 10 days at controlled temperature (23 °C), with daily follatures.
nebbiolo.zona: Arnad and Issogne. Age 30. Surface 1,5 ha, Guyot wall; 7.500 feet plant per hectare. Yield 5.500 kg/ha.
nebbiolo.affinamento: Aging of 12 months in stainless steel. Aging in bottle for 3 months.

content.text: The Nebbiolo, typical of Piedmont, has always been present in Valle d'Aosta, where it is traditionally grown under the name of Picotendro, in the alluvial valley of glacial origin of the Arnad and Issogne catchment areas. We dedicate ourselves to the vinification of this historical variety, to enhance its mountain identity.

content.title: YEAR 2021
content.text: Our label expresses the essential link with the mountain territory, made of steep slopes and Alpine ridges, which here reach the highest peaks (hence the French name Les Crêtes). The Metal cast in relief, bright as our sun, to exalt the depth of the valleys dug by glaciers. The vineyards, outlined on the peaks in the various exhibitions, to represent the wealth of a And at their feet, the Wine Hut with our cellar, a tribute to heroic viticulture and to the St. John’s The terroir, which allows us a niche production, cultured by the Alps.

content.title: YEAR 2021
content.text: The 2021 vintage had a particular development, with a cool winter and a spring with temperatures decidedly below average in particular during the months of May and June to the point of making it difficult for the flowers and the development of the bunch. From then on dry and dry until mid-September with some very hot days but in the norm. The harvest started with a delay of about ten days and with very small quantities but with excellent quality. The climatic development and the maturation of the grapes led to more fresh and aromatic wines with lower and balanced gradations and sensations very typical of mountain wines. The 2021 wines have a great tannic structure that will surely be a key factor to ensure longevity and power for many years.
Mixed boiled, veal kidney, ravioli with roast sauce.

nebbiolos.name: Nebbiolo Sommet Valle d’Aosta D.O.P.
nebbiolos.title: nebbiolos
nebbiolos.vinificazione: Destemming of the refrigerated grapes, fermentation with whole berries for 10 days at controlled temperature (23°C), with daily follatures.
nebbiolos.zona: Arnad and Issogne. Age 30 Surface 1.5 ha approx, slab at Guyot; plant of 7,500 feet per hectare. Yield 5,500 kg/ha.
nebbiolos.affinamento: Aging of 12 months in French oak from 25Hl. Aging in bottle of 1 year.

content.text: The Nebbiolo, typical of Piedmont, has always been present in Valle d'Aosta, where it is traditionally cultivated under the name of Picotendro, in the alluvial valley of glacial origin of the Arnad and Issogne catchment areas. We dedicate ourselves to the vinification of this historical variety, to enhance the mountain identity, so our Nebbiolo 'Sommet', which in French means 'top', In honor of the mountains that rock their vineyards.

content.title: YEAR 2015
content.text: Our label expresses the essential link with the mountain territory, made of steep slopes and alpine ridges, which reach here the highest peaks (hence the French name Les Crêtes). The metal foil cast in relief, bright as our sun, to enhance the depth of the valleys carved by glaciers. The vineyards, drawn on the peaks in the different exhibitions, to represent the wealth of a land stolen from the mountains. And at their feet, the Wine Refuge with our cellar, an ode to heroic viticulture and terroir, which allow us a niche production, cradled by the Alps.

content.title: YEAR 2020
content.text: The year 2020 was characterized by a very hot and dry spring, followed by the months of May and June with temperatures below average; the summer course was regular, As well as the harvest season, which began in the first days of September. The harvest ended at the beginning of November with the cutting of late varieties, Petite Arvine and Fumin; in general the vines had an abundant and very balanced production, aspects that are reflected on wines, which are endowed with great elegance and verticality.
Mixed boiled, veal kidney, ravioli with roast sauce.

pinot.name: Pinot Noir Valle d’Aosta D.O.P.
pinot.title: pinot
pinot.vinificazione: Chilled grape destemming, 2-day whole-grain cryo-fermentation, 8-day temperature controlled (22 °C) stainless steel fermentation with daily rebuilds.
pinot.zona: The Tour of Aymavilles. Age 20 years. Surface 3,0 ha approximately, system to Guyot; plant of 7.500 feet per hectare, rows to ciglione and retouching. Yield 9,000 kg/ha.
pinot.affinamento: Aging in stainless steel of 6 months.

content.text: Les Crêtes, with the processing of its Pinot Noir in steel only, gets an elegant mountain pinot, which is distinguished by bright color and a complex and crunchy fruit.

content.title: YEAR 1995
content.text: Our label expresses the essential link with the mountain territory, made of steep slopes and alpine ridges, which reach here the highest peaks (hence the French name Les Crêtes). The metal foil cast in relief, bright as our sun, to enhance the depth of the valleys carved by glaciers. The vineyards, drawn on the peaks in the different exhibitions, to represent the wealth of a land stolen from the mountains. And at their feet, the Wine Refuge with our cellar, an ode to heroic viticulture and terroir, which allow us a niche production, cradled by the Alps.

content.title: YEAR 2023
content.text: The 2023 vintage was undoubtedly very important from every point of view, from May to June temperatures and precipitation were average, after two years of heat and drought, and for this the development of the grapes was optimal. The month of August was characterized by waves of hot wind that have anticipated the harvest of the sparkling base on August 28, and then proceed in accordance with the years passed for the collection of other varieties. The harvest ended at the end of October with the cutting of the Petite Arvine for the whites and for the reds in early November, with the Fumin. The peculiarity of this vintage is that it has very sapid and fresh wines, in general the varietal characteristics are accentuated and the reserves promise a great longevity.
Beef meat, rabbit roll with olives, crepes with Valdostana.

revei.name: Pinot Nero Revei Valle d’Aosta D.O.P.
revei.title: revei
revei.vinificazione: Selection and destemming of the refrigerated grapes, 2-day whole berry cryofermentation, 12 days of fermentation in stainless steel at controlled temperature (23 C°), Svinatura to precede the end of fermentation.
revei.zona: Les Cretes of Aymavilles. 0.60 ha approximately, system to Guyot; plant of 7,500 feet per hectare, rows to ciglione and retouching. Yield 4,000 kg/ha.
revei.affinamento: Aging for 18 months in barrels of 700 L used. Bottling without filtration and stabilization. Refining in bottle for 18 months.

content.text: Revei Pinot Noir, which in Patois means pride, is linked to the history of the medieval tower, which dominates our vineyard of Aymavilles and from which it comes. The tower was the home of a hermit watchmaker, who with his craft, brought us to the theme of time and its value, in nature and for man. From here the Revei is born, son of great experience and long waiting. In its creation, time plays a fundamental role from maturation to refinement. Here time is extended to obtain, from the grapes brought to optimal ripening, the best expressive potential of the mountain Pinot Noir, refined with skill, It still rests in our cellars for a long time.

content.title: YEAR 2017
content.text: Our label expresses the essential link with the mountain territory, made of steep slopes and Alpine ridges, which here reach the highest peaks (hence the French name Les Crêtes). The Metal cast in relief, bright as our sun, to exalt the depth of the valleys dug by glaciers. The vineyards, outlined on the peaks in the various exhibitions, to represent the wealth of a And at their feet, the Wine Hut with our cellar, a tribute to heroic viticulture and to the St. John’s The terroir, which allows us a niche production, cultured by the Alps.

content.title: YEAR 2021
content.text: The 2021 vintage had a particular development, with a cool winter and a spring with temperatures decidedly below average in particular during the months of May and June to the point of making it difficult for the flowers and the development of the bunch. From then on dry and dry until mid-September with some very hot days but in the norm. The harvest started with a delay of about ten days and with very small quantities but with excellent quality. The climatic development and the maturation of the grapes led to more fresh and aromatic wines with lower and balanced gradations and sensations very typical of mountain wines. The 2021 wines have a great tannic structure that will surely be a key factor to ensure longevity and power for many years.
Braised calf’s cheek, aged Gressoney toma, liver crostini, saffron risotto with bone marrow.

sabla.name: La Sabla® – Vino Rosso
sabla.title: sabla
sabla.vinificazione: Destemming of the refrigerated grapes, 10-day fermentation in stainless steel at controlled temperature (26°C) with daily remixing.
sabla.zona: Localities La Sabla, Bufferia and Sazzé di Aymavilles. Age from 20 to 70. Surface area 4,0 ha approx. Guyot system; 8,000 feet per hectare, row of ciglione and retouching.
sabla.affinamento: Aging in stainless steel of 8 months. Aging in bottle of 5 months.

content.text: Fruity and enveloping the Sabla is produced by the Charrère family since 1971. It is the historic wine of the winery, today as then, made from a skilful blend of red berried varieties, grown in old vineyards. Sabla means sand in the local dialect, due to the sandy composition of the soil.

content.title: YEAR 1971
content.text: Our label expresses the essential link with the mountain territory, made of steep slopes and Alpine ridges, which here reach the highest peaks (hence the French name Les Crêtes). The Metal cast in relief, bright as our sun, to exalt the depth of the valleys dug by glaciers. The vineyards, outlined on the peaks in the various exhibitions, to represent the wealth of a And at their feet, the Wine Hut with our cellar, a tribute to heroic viticulture and to the St. John’s The terroir, which allows us a niche production, cultured by the Alps.

content.title: YEAR 2022
content.text: The 2022 vintage was characterized by a long period of heat and unusual drought, which from the beginning of May lasted until late October; this particular climate has brought a harvest advance of about 20 days, so the beginning was on August 16, with the bases sparkling. The harvest ended in the last days of October with the late maturing reds Fumin and Nebbiolo. The wines of this vintage are endowed with great concentration and aromaticity, in the oldest vineyards and with deep roots, there has been a holding of abundant acidity, which has led to a great deal of complexity in the reserves.
Donkey salami, grilled meat, stewed tripe, milk pig’s edge.

sabla50.name: La Sabla® 50 years
sabla50.title: sabla50
sabla50.vinificazione: Destemming and fermentation of the grapes separately for 13 days at controlled temperature, for the fumin passito wood fermentation.
sabla50.zona: Aymavilles. Surface area of 1.5 ha, system at Guyot; plant 7,500 feet per hectare, rows to retouch. Yield 60,000 kg/ha.
sabla50.affinamento: Aging of 1 year in oak barrels. Further aging of 1 year after the blend in oak barrels. 1 year of aging in steel. 2 years of aging in bottle.

content.text: With the Sabla 50 years we pay tribute to the first wine produced in the historic cellars of the house Charrère, by Constantine’s father and then first of all vinified in 1970 by Costantino, Just in homage to his father. It was born as a typical red wine, made with the best of what the vineyard could give. To celebrate the anniversary, from our best vineyards, today a limited production of La Sabla 50 years, which sees the meeting of Petit Rouge, Fumin, Syrah and Merlot and a part of Fumin decayed vinified in wood. Its long aging (2 years in wood and 2 years in steel) allows the full expression of the potential of this extremely versatile blend.

content.title: YEAR 2020
content.text: Our label expresses the essential link with the mountain territory, made of steep slopes and Alpine ridges, which here reach the highest peaks (hence the French name Les Crêtes). The Metal cast in relief, bright as our sun, to exalt the depth of the valleys dug by glaciers. The vineyards, outlined on the peaks in the various exhibitions, to represent the wealth of a And at their feet, the Wine Hut with our cellar, a tribute to heroic viticulture and to the St. John’s The terroir, which allows us a niche production, cultured by the Alps.

content.title: YEAR 2020
content.text: The year 2020 was characterized by a very hot and dry spring, followed by the months of May and June with temperatures below average; the summer course was regular, As well as the harvest season, which began in the first days of September. The harvest ended at the beginning of November with the cutting of late varieties, Petite Arvine and Fumin; in general the vines had an abundant and very balanced production, aspects that are reflected on wines, which are endowed with great elegance and verticality.
Juniper boar with cranberry reduction, venison salami, Bleu d'Aoste risotto with crispy bacon zest.

syrah.name: Syrah Valle d’Aosta D.O.P.
syrah.title: syrah
syrah.vinificazione: Destemming of the refrigerated grapes, fermentation for 12 days in stainless steel at controlled temperature (24 °C), with daily remixing.
syrah.zona: The Tour of Aymavilles. Age 16 years. Surface 1.5 ha approximately, system to Guyot; plant of 8,000 feet per hectare, rows to ciglione and retouching. Yield 8,000 kg/ha.
syrah.affinamento: Aging of 12 months in French oak barrels from 300 l. Aging in bottle for 6 months

content.text: Les Crêtes began to produce its Syrah in 1995 as a table wine because it was not recognized as D.O.P. in the Aosta Valley.In 2007 the legislation changed and since then Les Crêtes continues to produce its Syrah D.O.P., Renowned for its minerality and freshness, linked to its mountain character.

content.title: YEAR 2004
content.text: Our label expresses the essential link with the mountain territory, made of steep slopes and Alpine ridges, which here reach the highest peaks (hence the French name Les Crêtes). The Metal cast in relief, bright as our sun, to exalt the depth of the valleys dug by glaciers. The vineyards, outlined on the peaks in the various exhibitions, to represent the wealth of a And at their feet, the Wine Hut with our cellar, a tribute to heroic viticulture and to the St. John’s The terroir, which allows us a niche production, cultured by the Alps.

content.title: YEAR 2020
content.text: The year 2020 was characterized by a very hot and dry spring, followed by the months of May and June with temperatures below average; the summer course was regular, As well as the harvest season, which began in the first days of September. The harvest ended at the beginning of November with the cutting of late varieties, Petite Arvine and Fumin; in general the vines had an abundant and very balanced production, aspects that are reflected on wines, which are endowed with great elegance and verticality.
Orange duck breast, Parisian escargot, wild boar tagliatelle.

torrettesup.name: Torrette Superiore Valle d’Aosta D.O.P.
torrettesup.title: torrettesup
torrettesup.vinificazione: Destemming of the refrigerated grapes, fermentation for 8 days in stainless steel at a controlled temperature (26 °C), with daily remixing.
torrettesup.zona: Vineyards Les Toules of Sarre, historical vocation area of the Torrette. Surface area 2.5 ha approximately, system to Guyot; plant of 7,500 feet per hectare, rows to retouch. Yield 8,000 kg/ha.
torrettesup.affinamento: Aging in stainless steel of 8 months. Aging in bottle of 6 months.

content.text: Torrette is the D.O.C. of the most extensive area of the Aosta Valley, from which the wine of the same name is born. Vinified with a predominant base of Petit Rouge (autochthonous variety), it is the most widespread and traditionally consumed autochthonous wine in the region. The Torrette acquires the Superior qualification, for the long refinement that it requires.

content.title: YEAR 2014
content.text: Our label expresses the essential link with the mountain territory, made of steep slopes and Alpine ridges, which here reach the highest peaks (hence the French name Les Crêtes). The Metal cast in relief, bright as our sun, to exalt the depth of the valleys dug by glaciers. The vineyards, outlined on the peaks in the various exhibitions, to represent the wealth of a And at their feet, the Wine Hut with our cellar, a tribute to heroic viticulture and to the St. John’s The terroir, which allows us a niche production, cultured by the Alps.

content.title: YEAR 2023
content.text: The 2023 vintage was undoubtedly very important from every point of view, from May to June temperatures and precipitation were average, after two years of heat and drought, and for this the development of the grapes was optimal. The month of August was characterized by waves of hot wind that have anticipated the harvest of the sparkling base on August 28, and then proceed in accordance with the years passed for the collection of other varieties. The harvest ended at the end of October with the cutting of the Petite Arvine for the whites and for the reds in early November, with the Fumin. The peculiarity of this vintage is that it has very sapid and fresh wines, in general the varietal characteristics are accentuated and the reserves promise a great longevity.
Mocetta, fontina d'alpeggio, Favò valdostana, Valpellinenze soup.

torrette.name: Torrette Valle d’Aosta D.O.P.
torrette.title: torrette
torrette.vitigni: Petit Rouge 70%, Varietà Autoctone 30% (Mayolet, Cornalin, Fumin)
torrette.vinificazione: Destemming of the refrigerated grapes, fermentation of 12 days in stainless steel at controlled temperature (26°C), with daily reassembling.
torrette.zona: Vineyards located in the municipalities of Aymavilles, St. Pierre, Gressan and St. Christophe. Surface area 2.0 ha approximately, system in Guyot; plant of 7,500 feet per hectare, rows to ciglione and retocchino. Yield 8,000 kg/ ha.
torrette.affinamento: Aging in stainless steel of 6 months. Aging in bottle of 2 months.

content.text: Torrette is the D.O.C. of the most extensive area of the Aosta Valley, from which the wine of the same name is born. Vinified with a predominantly Petit Rouge base (autochthonous variety), it is the most widespread and traditionally consumed autochthonous wine in the region.

content.title: YEAR 1991
content.text: Our label expresses the essential link with the mountain territory, made of steep slopes and Alpine ridges, which here reach the highest peaks (hence the French name Les Crêtes). The Metal cast in relief, bright as our sun, to exalt the depth of the valleys dug by glaciers. The vineyards, outlined on the peaks in the various exhibitions, to represent the wealth of a And at their feet, the Wine Hut with our cellar, a tribute to heroic viticulture and to the St. John’s The terroir, which allows us a niche production, cultured by the Alps.

content.title: YEAR 2023
content.text: The 2023 vintage was undoubtedly very important from every point of view, from May to June temperatures and precipitation were average, after two years of heat and drought, and for this the development of the grapes was optimal. The month of August was characterized by waves of hot wind that have anticipated the harvest of the sparkling base on August 28, and then proceed in accordance with the years passed for the collection of other varieties. The harvest ended at the end of October with the cutting of the Petite Arvine for the whites and for the reds in early November, with the Fumin. The peculiarity of this vintage is that it has very sapid and fresh wines, in general the varietal characteristics are accentuated and the reserves promise a great longevity.
Cold cuts and salami, polenta with mushrooms, roast meats and grilled meats. Traditionally eaten in the Valle d'Aosta at all times.

chardonnaycb.name: Chardonnay Cuvée Bois Valle d’Aosta D.O.P.
chardonnaycb.title: chardonnaycb
chardonnaycb.vinificazione: Selection of grapes, refrigeration and soft pressing of whole cluster of 7 crus, fermentation in French oak barrels from 300 L.
chardonnaycb.zona: 7 crus located in different municipalities of the center valley. Age 20 years. Surface area 4 ha approximately, system to Guyot; density of plant of 7.500 feet per hectare, rows to ciglione and retocchino. Yield 8.000 kg/ha.
chardonnaycb.affinamento: Aging 'sur lies' of 12 months, with weekly bâtonnages. Barriques used at 50% new and 50% second pass. Aging in bottle for 12 months.

content.text: Chardonnay large and structured, recognized for elegance and style. The noble tannins derived from precious woods, the sur lies refinement and the repeated bâtonnages give it extraordinary complexity and remarkable balance. The name Cuvèe Bois comes from its method of aging in 'cuves' barriques of French oak 'bois'

content.title: YEAR 1995
content.text: Our label expresses the essential link with the mountain territory, made of steep slopes and Alpine ridges, which here reach the highest peaks (hence the French name Les Crêtes). The Metal cast in relief, bright as our sun, to exalt the depth of the valleys dug by glaciers. The vineyards, outlined on the peaks in the various exhibitions, to represent the wealth of a And at their feet, the Wine Hut with our cellar, a tribute to heroic viticulture and to the St. John’s The terroir, which allows us a niche production, cultured by the Alps.

content.title: YEAR 2022
content.text: The 2022 vintage was characterized by a long period of heat and unusual drought, which lasted from the beginning of May until late October; this particular climate has brought a harvest advance of about 20 days, so the beginning was on August 16, with the bases sparkling. The harvest ended in the last days of October with the late-ripening reds Fumin and Nebbiolo. The wines of this vintage are endowed with great concentration and aromaticity, in the oldest vineyards and with deep roots, there has been a holding of abundant acidity, which has led to a great deal of complexity in the reserves.
Foie gras, truffle noodles, fillet in hazelnut crust, fondue valdostana.

chardonnay.name: Chardonnay Valle d’Aosta D.O.P.
chardonnay.title: chardonnay
chardonnay.vinificazione: Soft cooling and pressing of whole bunches of grapes, fermentation for 12 days in stainless steel at controlled temperature (14°c).
chardonnay.zona: Les Crêtes di Aymavilles, Frissonnière di Saint Christophe. Età anni 20. Area of 6 ha, system a Guyot; plant 7,500 feet per hectare, filari a ciglione e ritocchino. Yield 9,000 kg/ha.

content.text: Mineral and varietal Chardonnay. Its mountain character acquired from the cultivation terroir, makes it unmistakable for the pronounced freshness.

content.title: YEAR 1991
content.text: Our label expresses the essential link with the mountain territory, made of steep slopes and Alpine ridges, which here reach the highest peaks (hence the French name Les Crêtes). The Metal cast in relief, bright as our sun, to exalt the depth of the valleys dug by glaciers. The vineyards, outlined on the peaks in the various exhibitions, to represent the wealth of a And at their feet, the Wine Hut with our cellar, a tribute to heroic viticulture and to the St. John’s The terroir, which allows us a niche production, cultured by the Alps.

content.title: YEAR 2023
content.text: The 2023 vintage was undoubtedly very important from every point of view, from May to June temperatures and precipitation were average, after two years of heat and drought, and for this the development of the grapes was optimal. The month of August was characterized by waves of hot wind that have anticipated the harvest of the sparkling base on August 28, and then proceed in accordance with the years passed for the collection of other varieties. The harvest ended at the end of October with the cutting of the Petite Arvine for the whites and the reds in early November, with the Fumin. The peculiarity of this vintage is that it has very sapid and fresh wines, in general the varietal characteristics are accentuated and the reserves promise a great longevity.
Cold cuts and cheeses, elaborate pasta dishes, rabbit with the Ligurian sauce, gnocchi with the bava. Also suitable as an aperitif.

monblanc.name: Mon Blanc – Vino bianco
monblanc.title: monblanc
monblanc.vitigni: Blend of native and international white berry varieties.
monblanc.vinificazione: Soft refrigeration and pressing of whole grapes, fermentation of 12 days in stainless steel at a temperature of 14°C.
monblanc.zona: Various vineyards. Age 15 years. Surface 2.50 ha, system in Guyot; plant 7,500 feet per hectare, rows of ciglione and retouching. Yield 8,000 kg/ ha.

content.text: Delicate and fruity, Mon Blanc is a blend of native and international varieties from various vineyards. It is dedicated to those who want a pleasant wine that is easy to drink. Its name comes from a play on words (in French Mon Blanc and Mont Blanc mean Mio white and Mont Blanc)

content.title: YEAR 1995
content.text: Our label expresses the essential link with the mountain territory, made of steep slopes and Alpine ridges, which here reach the highest peaks (hence the French name Les Crêtes). The Metal cast in relief, bright as our sun, to exalt the depth of the valleys dug by glaciers. The vineyards, outlined on the peaks in the various exhibitions, to represent the wealth of a And at their feet, the Wine Hut with our cellar, a tribute to heroic viticulture and to the St. John’s The terroir, which allows us a niche production, cultured by the Alps.

content.title: YEAR 2020
content.text: The 2023 vintage was undoubtedly very important from every point of view, from May to June temperatures and precipitation were average, after two years of heat and drought, and for this the development of the grapes was optimal. The month of August was characterized by waves of hot wind that have anticipated the harvest of the sparkling base on August 28, and then proceed in accordance with the years passed for the collection of other varieties. The harvest ended at the end of October with the cutting of the Petite Arvine for the whites and for the reds in early November, with the Fumin. The peculiarity of this vintage is that it has very sapid and fresh wines, in general the varietal characteristics are accentuated and the reserves promise a great longevity.
Fish appetizers, white meats, fresh cheeses, steamed fish, omelettes, savoury cakes.

neige.name: Neige d’Or Valle d’Aosta D.O.P.
neige.title: neige
neige.vinificazione: Selection, refrigeration and soft pressing of the whole bunch of grapes; fermentation in French oak barrels of 30 hl and in French oak barrels of 300 L.
neige.zona: Several vineyards in Valle d'Aosta. Age 30 years. Surface area of about 0.80 ha, wall slatted in Guyot; plant 7,500 feet per hectare, rows with garter and retouching. Yield 6,000 kg/ ha.
neige.affinamento: Aging 'sur lies' of 12 months and aging in bottle of 18 months.

content.text: Neige D'Or is an important and vertical blend of white berried grapes, selected and vinified with the experience of over 40 years, on different varieties with different types of aging. It is the result of a combination that combines the specific characteristics of the Petite Arvine, aged in large cask and the Pinot Grigio, aged in barrique. The name Neige d'Or (in Italian Neve d'oro), draws inspiration from the preciousness and minerality of the Cuvèe.

content.title: YEAR 2015
content.text: Our label expresses the essential link with the mountain territory, made of steep slopes and Alpine ridges, which here reach the highest peaks (hence the French name Les Crêtes). The Metal cast in relief, bright as our sun, to exalt the depth of the valleys dug by glaciers. The vineyards, outlined on the peaks in the various exhibitions, to represent the wealth of a And at their feet, the Wine Hut with our cellar, a tribute to heroic viticulture and to the St. John’s The terroir, which allows us a niche production, cultured by the Alps.

content.title: YEAR 2020
content.text: The year 2020 was characterized by a very hot and dry spring, followed by the months of May and June with temperatures below average; the summer course was regular, As well as the harvest season, which began in the first days of September. The harvest ended at the beginning of November with the cutting of late varieties, Petite Arvine and Fumin; in general the vines had an abundant and very balanced production, aspects that are reflected on wines, which are endowed with great elegance and verticality.
Clarified butter and anchovies, fried eel, frog tail in a guazzetto, Catalan lobster, fontina d'alpeggio.

petitearvine.name: Petite Arvine Valle d’Aosta D.O.P.
petitearvine.title: petitearvine
petitearvine.vinificazione: Soft cooling and pressing of whole grapes, fermentation for 12 days in stainless steel at controlled temperature (14 °C).
petitearvine.zona: Champorette and Bufferia of Aymavilles, Frissonnière of Saint Christophe. Age 30 years. Surface 6.50 ha approximately, system to Guyot; plant of 7,500 feet per hectare, rows to ciglione and retocchino. Yield 10.000 kg/ha.

content.text: Le Petite Arvine is a traditional late-ripening grape. Its name comes from the variety - Arvine - and from the small size (Petite in French) of its berries. This wine, emblem of the Valle d'Aosta territory, is characterized by an intense minerality, accentuated salinity and a characterizing aromatic profile.

content.title: YEAR 1992
content.text: Our label expresses the essential link with the mountain territory, made of steep slopes and Alpine ridges, which here reach the highest peaks (hence the French name Les Crêtes). The Metal cast in relief, bright as our sun, to exalt the depth of the valleys dug by glaciers. The vineyards, outlined on the peaks in the various exhibitions, to represent the wealth of a And at their feet, the Wine Hut with our cellar, a tribute to heroic viticulture and to the St. John’s The terroir, which allows us a niche production, cultured by the Alps.

content.title: YEAR 2023
content.text: The 2023 vintage was undoubtedly very important from every point of view, from May to June temperatures and precipitation were average, after two years of heat and drought, and for this the development of the grapes was optimal. The month of August was characterized by waves of hot wind that have anticipated the harvest of the sparkling base on August 28, and then proceed in accordance with the years passed for the collection of other varieties. The harvest ended at the end of October with the cutting of the Petite Arvine for the whites and for the reds in early November, with the Fumin. The peculiarity of this vintage is that it has very sapid and fresh wines, in general the varietal characteristics are accentuated and the reserves promise a great longevity.
Marinated tuna carpaccio, linguine with pesto, salted bream, salmon trout with herbs, also suitable as an aperitif.

petitefleur.name: Fleur – Petite Arvine Valle d’Aosta D.O.P.
petitefleur.title: petitefleur
petitefleur.vinificazione: Selection of grapes, cooling and soft pressing of the whole bunch of grapes, fermentation for 12 days in stainless steel at a controlled temperature (13 °C).
petitefleur.zona: Montjovet (AO). 1.50 ha approximately, system to Guyot; plant of 7,500 feet per hectare, rows to ciglione and retocchino. Yield 8,000 kg/ha.

content.text: The Petite Arvine Fleur grows in a single vineyard in the Montjovet valley, historically recognized for its quality of production. From here comes to life a concentrated and rich aroma Petite Arvine.

content.title: YEAR 2014
content.text: Our label expresses the essential link with the mountain territory, made of steep slopes and Alpine ridges, which here reach the highest peaks (hence the French name Les Crêtes). The Metal cast in relief, bright as our sun, to exalt the depth of the valleys dug by glaciers. The vineyards, outlined on the peaks in the various exhibitions, to represent the wealth of a And at their feet, the Wine Hut with our cellar, a tribute to heroic viticulture and to the St. John’s The terroir, which allows us a niche production, cultured by the Alps.

content.text: The 2023 vintage was undoubtedly very important from every point of view, from May to June temperatures and precipitation were average, after two years of heat and drought, and for this the development of the grapes was optimal. The month of August was characterized by waves of hot wind that have anticipated the harvest of the sparkling base on August 28, and then proceed in accordance with the years passed for the collection of other varieties. The harvest ended at the end of October with the cutting of the Petite Arvine for the whites and for the reds in early November, with the Fumin. The peculiarity of this vintage is that it has very sapid and fresh wines, in general the varietal characteristics are accentuated and the reserves promise a great longevity.
Tataki salmon, steamed dumplings, fresh goat’s milk, mushroom risotto.

pinotgris.name: Pinot Gris Brulant Valle d’Aosta D.O.P.
pinotgris.title: pinotgris
pinotgris.vinificazione: Soft refrigeration and pressing of whole grapes, 15-day fermentation in stainless steel at controlled temperature (13°C).
pinotgris.zona: Les Crêtes of Aymavilles, Saint Nicolas. Surface area about 0.60 ha, system in Guyot; plant of 7,500 feet per hectare, rows to ciglione and retocchino. Yield 3,500 kg/ ha.
pinotgris.affinamento: It refines 'sur lies' of 9 months with daily bâtonnages, 4 months of aging in bottle

content.text: This Pinot Gris is the result of our Alpine Terroir with a clear varietal identity: its grapes are harvested at full maturity and, after one night of cooling, they are pressed whole, to preserve the precious and delicate aromatic. The yield is low because it is new vineyards, in the first years of production, which have replaced the old vines that gave life to our historic Pinot Grigio Brulant in 1994.

content.title: YEAR 2018
content.text: Our label expresses the essential link with the mountain territory, made of steep slopes and Alpine ridges, which here reach the highest peaks (hence the French name Les Crêtes). The Metal cast in relief, bright as our sun, to exalt the depth of the valleys dug by glaciers. The vineyards, outlined on the peaks in the various exhibitions, to represent the wealth of a And at their feet, the Wine Hut with our cellar, a tribute to heroic viticulture and to the St. John’s The terroir, which allows us a niche production, cultured by the Alps.

content.title: YEAR 2023
content.text: The 2023 vintage was undoubtedly very important from every point of view, from May to June temperatures and precipitation were average, after two years of heat and drought, and for this the development of the grapes was optimal. The month of August was characterized by waves of hot wind that have anticipated the harvest of the sparkling base on August 28, and then proceed in accordance with the years passed for the collection of other varieties. The harvest ended at the end of October with the cutting of the Petite Arvine for the whites and for the reds in early November, with the Fumin. The peculiarity of this vintage is that it has very sapid and fresh wines, in general the varietal characteristics are accentuated and the reserves promise a great longevity.
Seafood appetizers, scallops gratinate, paella, mountain trout with herbs.

rows: Luca Maroni-Annuario dei Migliori Vini Italiani

rose.name: Rosé Valle d’Aosta D.O.P.
rose.title: rose
rose.vinificazione: 3 hours of film maceration of grapes in whole bunch refrigerated in press. 12-day fermentation in stainless steel at controlled temperature (14 °C).
rose.zona: About 1 ha, system in Guyot; plant of 7,500 feet per hectare, rows with ciglione and retouching. Yield 8,000 kg/ ha.

content.text: The grapes in composition of our rose come from different clones of the autochthonous variety Petit Rouge and from old vines, which contribute to its remarkable organoleptic complexity. With the vinification in rose, we wanted to give this variety a new look, going out of the traditional schemes, which see the vinification in red with the Torrette, the most extensive and oldest name of Valle d'Aosta.

content.title: YEAR 2019
content.text: Our label expresses the essential link with the mountain territory, made of steep slopes and Alpine ridges, which here reach the highest peaks (hence the French name Les Crêtes). The Metal cast in relief, bright as our sun, to exalt the depth of the valleys dug by glaciers. The vineyards, outlined on the peaks in the various exhibitions, to represent the wealth of a And at their feet, the Wine Hut with our cellar, a tribute to heroic viticulture and to the St. John’s The terroir, which allows us a niche production, cultured by the Alps.

content.title: YEAR 2023
content.text: The 2023 vintage was undoubtedly very important from every point of view, from May to June temperatures and precipitation were average, after two years of heat and drought, and for this the development of the grapes was optimal. The month of August was characterized by waves of hot wind that have anticipated the harvest of the sparkling base on August 28, and then proceed in accordance with the years passed for the collection of other varieties. The harvest ended at the end of October with the cutting of the Petite Arvine for the whites and the reds in early November, with the Fumin. The peculiarity of this vintage is that it has very sapid and fresh wines, in general the varietal characteristics are accentuated and the reserves promise a great longevity.
Fried seafood, crudités, blue fish, pizza cooked in a wood oven, also suitable as an aperitif.

rows: Luca Maroni - Annuario dei migliori vini Italiani
Vini Buoni d’Italia – Touring Club Italiano
Luca Maroni - Annuario dei migliori vini Italiani
Luca Maroni - Annuario dei migliori vini Italiani
3 Diamanti + 1 stella x eccellenza nella sua categoria

dore.name: Doré – Wine from Uva Stramature
dore.title: dore
dore.vinificazione: Wine-growing in the plant, soft pressing of whole grapes, fermentation for 25 days at controlled temperature (13 °C)
dore.zona: Vineyards with different exposures and various laying. Surface 0.5 ha approximately, system to Guyot and Gobelet; plant of 8,000/10,000 feet per hectare. Rows of eyelet and retouching and free form. Yield 2,500 kg/ ha.
dore.affinamento: Aging 'sur lies' of 6 months. Aging in bottle of 6 months

content.text: The grapes of Dorè are harvested late in the year, before the first snowfall of the year. Its name comes from the intense golden color (dorè in French).

content.title: YEAR 2000
content.text: Our label expresses the essential link with the mountain territory, made of steep slopes and Alpine ridges, which here reach the highest peaks (hence the French name Les Crêtes). The Metal cast in relief, bright as our sun, to exalt the depth of the valleys dug by glaciers. The vineyards, outlined on the peaks in the various exhibitions, to represent the wealth of a And at their feet, the Wine Hut with our cellar, a tribute to heroic viticulture and to the St. John’s The terroir, which allows us a niche production, cultured by the Alps.

content.title: YEAR 2022
content.text: The 2022 vintage was characterized by a long period of heat and unusual drought, which from the beginning of May lasted until late October; this particular climate has brought a harvest advance of about 20 days, so the beginning was on August 16, with the bases sparkling. The harvest ended in the last days of October with the late maturing reds Fumin and Nebbiolo. The wines of this vintage are endowed with great concentration and aromaticity, in the oldest vineyards and with deep roots, there has been a holding of abundant acidity, which has led to a great deal of complexity in the reserves.
Strudel, dried fruit, extra dark chocolate, Valdostane tiles foie gras, bleu d'aoste, smoked trout. Also indicated as a meditation wine, to accompany moments of leisure and pleasure.

neblu.name: Neblù – Brut Nature Metodo Classico Rosé
neblu.title: neblu
neblu.vitigni: Rosé, international black berry 60%, Neblu 40% (native black berry variety)
neblu.vinificazione: Criomaceration in the press of grapes in whole bunch of 5 hours and subsequent soft pressing, fermentation for 12 days at controlled temperature (14 °C)
neblu.zona: Les Crêtes of Aymavilles. Surface 1,5 ha approximately, system to Guyot; plant of 7.500 feet per hectare, rows to retouch. Yield 10.000 kg/ha.
neblu.affinamento: Sparkling wine by the Classic Method and 'sur lies' aging of 30 months

content.text: The Neblù is an autochthonous grape variety from the Aosta Valley, traditionally vinified in red wine according to the Aosta Valley regulations. Since 2005, Les Crêtes has started the vinification in sparkling wine, giving birth to a unique classic method.

content.title: YEAR 2005
content.text: Our label expresses the essential link with the mountain territory, made of steep slopes and Alpine ridges, which here reach the highest peaks (hence the French name Les Crêtes). The Metal cast in relief, bright as our sun, to exalt the depth of the valleys dug by glaciers. The vineyards, outlined on the peaks in the various exhibitions, to represent the wealth of a And at their feet, the Wine Hut with our cellar, a tribute to heroic viticulture and to the St. John’s The terroir, which allows us a niche production, cultured by the Alps.

content.title: Year 2020
content.text: The year 2020 was characterized by a very hot and dry spring, followed by the months of May and June with temperatures below average; the summer course was regular, As well as the harvest season, which began in the first days of September. The harvest ended at the beginning of November with the cutting of late varieties, Petite Arvine and Fumin; in general the vines had an abundant and very balanced production, aspects that are reflected on wines, which are endowed with great elegance and verticality.
Crudités of fish and crustaceans, lobster mixture, blue fish in tempura; tatar of deer, salami, cheeses of short maturation.

reban.name: Rebàn Metodo Classico Pas Dosé
reban.title: reban
reban.vinificazione: Soft pressing of whole clusters, fermentation of 8-10 days in steel at controlled temperature. 40% of the total is destined for malolactic fermentation
reban.zona: Les Crêtes and Coteau of Aymavilles, Pompiod. Age years. Surface area 1 ha, system in Guyot; planting density of 7,500 feet per hectare, rows with ciglione and retocchino. Yield 7,000 kg/ha.
reban.affinamento: Sparkling wine with the classic method, 9 months in steel 'sur lies'. 42 months on the yeasts, milled and not dosed product

content.text: This is a unique wine from the traditional Petite Arvine grape, vinified in purity, limited edition, which combines its important acid frame with great elegance. Rebàn (in the dialect of Valle d'Aosta, 'Nastro'), was created to seal a special moment. It is a classic method of great expression of the mountain territory.

content.title: YEAR 2018
content.text: Our label expresses the essential link with the mountain territory, made of steep slopes and Alpine ridges, which here reach the highest peaks (hence the French name Les Crêtes). The Metal cast in relief, bright as our sun, to exalt the depth of the valleys dug by glaciers. The vineyards, outlined on the peaks in the various exhibitions, to represent the wealth of a And at their feet, the Wine Hut with our cellar, a tribute to heroic viticulture and to the St. John’s The terroir, which allows us a niche production, cultured by the Alps.

content.title: YEAR 2020
content.text: The 2019 vintage can be considered one of the best of the last decade in Valle d'Aosta and in particular the climatic evolution of the summer, hot but not dry, and a September with cool nights and sunny, windy days. The vines have had an abundant and very balanced production, aspects that are reflected in the wines, which are endowed with great elegance and verticality.
Gnocchetti with salmon trout and lemon thyme.

family.title: The experience of a family that, with passion, has been able to enhance the mountain wines of the Aosta Valley
family.descrizione: The company Les Crêtes was founded in 1989 in Aymavilles (Aosta Valley), by Costantino Charrère and is now managed by his family who, owner of a historic water mill from the 18th century and the old wineries in Via Moulins, has been producing food for five generations.

banner.title: Our strength is the care and passion we have for our land
banner.paragraph: A place where hospitality is at home and where you can live a unique experience in the mountains of Valle d'Aosta.

produzione.title: Produce in respect of the environment and man
produzione.descrizione: The total annual production is currently 250,000 bottles. The varieties grown are both indigenous (Petit Rouge, Fumin, Petite Arvine, Gros Rouge, Cornalin, Mayolet, Prëmetta) and international (Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, Syrah). The “tension” of the company is directed to the entire production chain, where interventions are carried out with he utmost attention and care, in the continuous search for quality.

artigianalità.title: Craftsmanship, love for work and dEdition: the roots of quality
artigianalità.descrizione: Each activity is performed with extreme dEdition and attention, reflecting the quality and passion that characterize us.
